alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 2:47PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Hunterdon and northwestern Bucks Counties through 330 PM EST... At 246 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Quakertown, or 12 miles southeast of Allentown, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Quakertown, Perkasie, Doylestown, Byram, Bedminster, Flemington, Tinicum, New Hope, Dublin, Ferndale, Frenchtown, Milford, Stockton, Pleasant Valley, Revere, Lumberville, Ottsville, Sergeantsville, Pipersville and Erwinna. This includes Northeast Extension between mile markers 43 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
